data.approach: Auditing displayTask derived state to ensure all session states show task info appropriately

data.taskTitle: Review displayTask for other missing states
summary: Simplified displayTask logic to show task info in all session states
Previously only showed lastCompletedTask in ready-for-review, completing, completed, and idle states
Now falls back to lastCompletedTask whenever task is null, covering needs-input, starting, compacting, and recovering states

filesModified.description: Simplified displayTask derived state to always fall back to lastCompletedTask

reviewFocus: Verify the simplified logic is correct - task || lastCompletedTask
Note: Build warnings are pre-existing (HooksEditor button nesting, not related to this change)

Review displayTask for other missing states

summary: Audited displayTask derived state in SessionCard.svelte
Identified 4 session states that were missing task display (needs-input, starting, compacting, recovering)
Simplified logic from complex conditional to simple fallback: task || lastCompletedTask

quality.preExisting: Build warnings pre-existing (type errors in other files, unrelated to this change)

suggestedTasks.title: Fix SessionState type mismatch for recovering state
suggestedTasks.description: StatusActionBadge.svelte defines SessionState without recovering, but SessionCard includes it. This causes TypeScript errors. Need to centralize the SessionState type definition.
suggestedTasks.reason: Discovered during audit - pre-existing type errors

patterns: displayTask now always falls back to lastCompletedTask - simpler and covers all states
gotchas: SessionState type is defined locally in multiple files - should be centralized
